Posts¶

class posts.views.PostDeleteView(**kwargs)[source]¶

PostDeleteView inherits from the DeleteView. These allow you to structure your views and reuse code by harnessing inheritance. All views inherit from the View class, which handles linking the view into the URLs, HTTP method dispatching and other common features.

get_object(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

This method followed a claas based view method. If the user is the owner of the post only then that particular user will able to delete the post, first that particular user will able to go into given template link and able to delete the post and will get back to the attached success url page after deletation. However if the user is not the owner of the post then the user will not be able to delete the post even if he has the url of the post. For this case it will show a error message.

Parameters

  • name – self - used to access the attributes and methods of the class in python

  • type – reference

  • name – *args - used to pass an arbitrary number of arguments to a function

  • type – pass variable

  • name – **kwargs - used to pass key-value parameters to the function

  • type – pass variable

Returns

str

success_url = '/posts/'¶
template_name = 'posts/confirm_del.html'¶
class posts.views.PostUpdateView(**kwargs)[source]¶

PostUpdateView inherits from the UpdateView. These allow you to structure your views and reuse code by harnessing inheritance. All views inherit from the View class, which handles linking the view into the URLs, HTTP method dispatching and other common features.

form_valid(form)[source]¶

This method followed a claas based view method. If the user is the owner of the post only then that particular user will able to update the post, first that particular user will able to go into given template link and able to update the post and will get back to the attached success url page after updating the post. However if the user is not the owner of the post then the user will not be able to update the post even if he has the url of the post. For this case it will show a error message.

Parameters

  • name – self - used to access the attributes and methods of the class in python

  • type – reference

  • name – form - used to take a form

  • type – take form

Returns

str

success_url = '/posts/'¶
template_name = 'posts/update.html'¶
posts.views.like_unlike_post(request)[source]¶

This method will create a like or unlike request on posts and upon successfull insertion, it will update the like or unlike. If the post status is liked will update it to unliked otherwise update it to liked. If the post previouly existed and its status is liked then will update it to unliked othwise will update it to liked. This method will only load this page if the user is logged in.

Parameters

  • name – request - used to generate responses(Http) depending on the request that it receives

  • type – HttpResponse

Returns

redirect the posts page

posts.views.post_comment_create_and_list_view(request)[source]¶

This method will create a post request on two separate forms post form and comment form and upon successfull insertion, it will update the form and will show in the post content or comment body. This method will only load this page if the user is logged in.

Parameters

  • name – request - used to generate responses(Http) depending on the request that it receives

  • type – HttpResponse

Returns

returns posts page
